website_summaries.verdict: This manual pump offers supreme comfort and makes it easy for moms to pump no matter where they are.
pros: Requires very little effort to pump, not causing pain in hands
Compact enough to comfortably fit in diaper bag or purse and only has 4 pieces to it
Works quickly and is very easy to clean
cons: Doesn’t come with carrying case or any additional accessories

customer_reviews.title: Great little pump!
customer_reviews.text: Love this pump! I can get more using this pump than using my electric one, and in HALF the time. Saves my sanity...Pieces are easy to assemble and clean and the silicone pad for the flange does make it a tiny bit more comfortable. Small, discreet, quiet, and lightweight. Perfect for travel, or in my case, daily pumps at work. Tip for use - once you let down just hold down the lever and ride out the flow. You do not have to constantly be squeezing the lever to pump milk (until towards the end of your session.)
customer_reviews.author: MP

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product!
customer_reviews.text: I do not usually write lengthy reviews but I was really impressed with this product. I did not want to spend a lot of money because I am mainly formula feeding. I saw the great reviews so decided to give this product a shot. I have tried other manual and electric pumps in the past and this was the MOST comfortable thing I have ever tried. It also worked REALLY well, way better than I expected for a manual pump! I love how compact it is and how easy it is to use. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: judy

customer_reviews.title: So noisy
customer_reviews.text: First I will say that the suction is pretty good, as you can see in the video it’s been productive. But you can also hear how noisy it is! I just received this pump yesterday, and this is my first time using it. After five minutes it started squeaking loudly. I definitely can’t use it while the babe is sleeping, or if I want to be even mildly discreet.
customer_reviews.author: MW

customer_reviews.title: Love love love
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this product I don't respond well electric pumps so I have a variety of manual pumps. This one is probably my third favorite its easy to use and makes hand pumping comfortable. It's also a relatively a very quick and effective pump. Now that being said I wish they would send a larger bottle then the 4oz to pump into. It is just much easier to hold while pumping
customer_reviews.author: jessica neels

customer_reviews.title: Loud and unreliable
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this pump. I kept using it even after realizing that the bottle portion unexpectedly unscrews during pumping. After one use, it became very squeaky. By the next time, it was loud enough to wake my baby sleeping in a different room. I really liked the silicone flange so I ordered another of these pumps, hoping mine was just a bad one. Unfortunately the second pump had the exact same issues- loud squeaking and bottle loosens on its own. I now have two of these pumps and won’t be able to take either to work because they’re too disruptive and the milk will spill as the bottle falls off.
customer_reviews.author: Dominguez

customer_reviews.title: Would be great if it stayed together
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea of this pump and it would work great if the top stayed attached to the bottle. The issue is most likely with the specific one I got but it is so frustrating and I hardly ever use this pump because of it. I've tried two separate bottles and neither will stay attached so I have to hold the bottle and the pump the entire time I'm pumping in order not to lose all my milk. I'm not sure who to contact to be sent a replacement top piece to see if that fixes it
customer_reviews.author: J.

customer_reviews.title: Okay, but not the best and gentler manual pump out there!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: lightweight, easy to assemble and disassemble, easy to clean, the handle is ergonomically design which makes it a lot easier to use, breastpad massage cushions are nipple friendly (just make sure to choose bet small and large size), parts or accessories can be readily bought at amazon. Cons: suction is okay, but at times it has a tendency to stop from suctioning and all you can hear is squeaking noise, the silicone breastpad massage cushion that comes with it can be too small for some women, and so you still need to order separately for a bigger size, doesn’t come with any addtl. perks like the other brand which offers free adapter, bag, and silicone collection cup
customer_reviews.author: Mikaela SJTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: If I could give it more stars I would...LOVE!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this manual pump even more than my electric one. I use it way more often...bedside, in the car, on the couch, at work. It is way more convenient than being attached to plugs. I also find it more effective at pumping since it has suction in the flange. The only complaint is that my hand has cramped up because I use it so much. But that's just because of using muscles I normally didn't use. Otherwise this pump has been a life-saver. Literally my right-hand man since I had the baby and I HIGHLY recommend it. Happy shopping!
customer_reviews.author: Happy Shopping

customer_reviews.title: Easy, comfortable, compact - highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to pump quickly and easily during a friend's wedding weekend and absolutely love it. Within 10 minutes I had hand-pumped a full 4 oz bottle, very comfortably. It is way more comfortable and - frankly - easy to use than my medala double-electric. Even though it's manual, I find it gets more milk, more comfortably than my medals. Super compact, fits in a purse to carry discreetly, and really well-made and easy to use quickly. Totally worth the very small investment to have a comfortable backup that makes pumping on the go easy and pretty darn effortless. Highly recommend for use when traveling or out of the house for a short while, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Lisena DeSantis

customer_reviews.title: Not good quality and one size does not fit all!
customer_reviews.text: Only used for a week and a half and things about it started not working or breaking. You cannot buy different nipple size pieces, so if you are bigger or smaller you are just out of luck! If you're bigger you can remove the rubber "petals" and it helps a little. It squeaks during use, which is incredibly annoying and will wake up baby (or just annoy you with every pump). The cup / bottle stopped screwing on after a week. Any little bump it could un screw and spill or drop whatever you have pumped. The Medela manual pump is cheaper, works better, and you can buy different nipple sizes. Save yourself money and just get that one.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Groshong

customer_reviews.title: Awesome. Got the real thing.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't give it five stars...yet. Because I only just received it so I want to test longevity first. I got a little colostrum out but didn't pump for real because I heard many recommendations against doing so. 1) They fit the avent bottles directly which is awesome, and so far also the MAM bottles. 2) Easy to take apart and sterilize fits in the avent sterilizer. 3) I also purchased the Avent milk storage cups . That fit perfectly and with the adapter you can put the nipple top directly on the cup instead of dirtying cup and bottle. All this also fits the avent sterilizer.
customer_reviews.author: Shannanniggins

customer_reviews.title: Love this pump
customer_reviews.text: I had a hospital-issued pump that a friend had given me and it was awful. I bought this one and am so glad I did. It's easy to pump, easy to take apart and clean, and I much prefer it to my electric pump. I strongly recommend it! I had to remove a star because it can get squeaky. It hasn't really been an issue because our baby sleeps through almost anything, but I felt it was worth noting.
customer_reviews.author: Hey Hey

customer_reviews.title: Love this pump
customer_reviews.text: 1 year into breastfeeding and still going strong with this pump (replaced valves and membrane). Like it better than my double electric. Faster and so quiet I can use it at work. Update: had another baby so i have been breastfeeding for almost 3 years straight. I use this exclusively when i need to pump (daily at work). Really recommend above 2 other manual ones I've tried and 3 electrics. I get more milk faster and more conveniently. Plus quiet.
customer_reviews.author: LL

customer_reviews.title: Like granddad's TV rabbit ears in b00b pump form
customer_reviews.text: I don't have a different manual pump to compare it to, but in itself it's acceptable. Super easy to assemble, but does take a "light touch" and some determination. It is supposed to be discreet, but it makes a (possibly mortifying) quacking noise 80% of the time. The Avent bottle tends to loosen while pumping so that has to be watched. BTW, those only safely hold 4oz. Good for parties and occasional use, but not a replacement for an electric.
customer_reviews.author: Digital Kamerad

customer_reviews.title: I love this pump
customer_reviews.text: I love this pump! I also have a double, electric pump, but sometimes I don't want to mess with it and use this instead. I also use it for when I am traveling or away from home for the day. It did take me a day or two to figure out how to use it best, and ever since then I can pump very quickly. Its very easy to take apart and wash, and fits easily in purses, diaper bags, etc. I recently went on vacation and left one of the pieces at home and was completely okay with buying another (having 2 works great!) I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great manual pump for out of the house pumping session
customer_reviews.text: I was using this pump mainly for trips out of the house, it is small, easy to assemble and super quite! It always helped with pumping large amounts of milk, even more than my electric spectra, and helped me to open plugged ducts and cure mastitis. I was an exclusive pumper so I needed a good pump for travel and this was the perfect solution. Plus it is so comfortable that after every pump session I would put on the nipple and my baby drank fresh milk, hot from the over :)
customer_reviews.author: Adva Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Staying on top of Milk production !!!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful !!! This is such a lifesaver to carry on the go in my diaper bag when breast feeding ! There are so many times when I need relief and she's sleeping away in someone's arms while visiting relatives. Just to slip into the restroom and be able to pump is so nice and convenient ! Or when we've been on a road trip to be able to pump in the car. It even works better then a cheaper electric pump I got as a gift. I would definitely recommend to the breast feeding Mom !
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Schlaudt

customer_reviews.title: Works great!  Fast and a must for times without your electric one
customer_reviews.text: This is a great manual pump. It is fast and efficient, and fit nicely on my spectra bottles as a quick swap out. If you wash and reassemble, sometimes it makes a squeeky sound while pumping. This was fixed by taking back apart and drying the top piece better. There are times I use this pump instead of my Spectra electric one because it is faster!
customer_reviews.author: Katrina M.

customer_reviews.title: Loose bottles and loud noises.
customer_reviews.text: I hate electric pumping and was really hoping I could find a manual version that worked for me. This was not it. I would only get a couple drops of milk then the flow would completely stop. Even if it did work in terms of pumping, I would have returned because of a design flaw. On several occasions, I noticed by the end of my pumping attempt, the bottle had become loosened almost to the point of falling off. That would be very upsetting if you managed to get a bottle of milk. Also, the squeaking/quacking sound is very obvious so be aware if you are thinking about getting this to be more discreet about pumping.
customer_reviews.author: Layla

customer_reviews.title: I love this manual pump
customer_reviews.text: I love this manual pump. It is comfortably and easy to use. The first time I assembled it, it took me a few minutes to figure out how it all fit together but it was easy to assemble after the first time. The suction is strong enough to draw milk but is not so strong that it becomes painful. The size it fairly compact. I have taken it with me in my purse and it is great to use on the go.
customer_reviews.author: Jessi S

customer_reviews.title: Squeals. And it’s terrible.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this manual pump months before a trip as I usually use a Spectra and that’s too bulky to travel with. Tried this pump out once then packed it well in advance. Used it 3x while on holiday and it sucks balls. The handle squeaks loudly so I cannot pump in vicinity of a sleeping baby. It also continually loses suction and I have to constantly reposition. I get a reasonable amount of milk, which is the one positive. I hate this pump and will be asking Avent for a refund as I’m way past Amazon’s return window.
customer_reviews.author: thrillhouse

customer_reviews.title: Game changer!
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with this manual pump! I have a double electric but bought this for a road trip where I expect my 1 month old to sleep for longer than 2-3 hours. I love using this when I'm watching tv in the living room (electric pump is in bedroom). It encourages me to pump more when I don't wanna be hooked up to the electric. I honestly feel like I pump out more than i do with my spectra s2. I have tons of avent bottles and love them so this manual was a perfect fit. There are really only 4 necessary pieces which I love. So simple and easy to use!
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: but it is my least favorite of the three
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased the Philips Avent, Lansinoh, and Medela Harmony manual pumps. I had high hopes for the Avent, but it is my least favorite of the three. I was constantly having to adjust this pump and I don't seem to get as much milk out when I use it. It now lives in storage in case my others break. I currently manually pump 3-4x a day and always use the Medela harmony pump with the lansinoh flange.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Herrig

customer_reviews.title: This was the perfect solution. I can quietly pump and not worry ...
customer_reviews.text: I needed a pump that wasn't going to tether me down because I have older toddlers that keep me on my toes. This was the perfect solution. I can quietly pump and not worry that my kids are going to get tangled in the equipment or unplug something. It's got a stronger suction than I was expecting which is awesome and it's compatible with every Advent bottle so I can just unscrew the pump & put a bottle top on. This has solved a lot of problems for me, if you're on the fence it's totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: The Johnsons

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and effective but difficult to see the milk
customer_reviews.text: Because you can control the speed/frequency of the pumping, it can be even more efficient than my electric pump, but without the bulk or noise. Because you don't have to worry about plug size/shape/voltage, it's great for international travel. (And it's especially important to pump on long flights because that can often dry up a woman's milk supply.) My only complaint is that the flange is shorter than in the older model, which makes it impossible to see how much milk is coming out. Do I need to reposition? Am I done? It's just a guess with this newer model.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Li

customer_reviews.title: It's relatively comfortable and pretty darn efficient
customer_reviews.text: I've been benefitting from this purchase way more than I expected. I originally bought it to try and pump one breast while my baby fed from the other in the mornings, but that didn't really work. Instead, I've been using it if we're out of the house for awhile and I need to pump, and at night for a quick pump before bed. It's relatively comfortable and pretty darn efficient. It's also discreet, easy, and quick. I'll definitely continue to use this.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Gazdowicz

customer_reviews.title: Great manual pump!
customer_reviews.text: After a lot of research, I'm so glad I decided to get this as a supplement to my electric Spectra pump. I used it for the first time this morning because my baby slept through the night and I woke up with leaking breasts. Instead of wasting my milk, I was able to quickly pump an ounce from each breast, which provided some relief until he woke up (and helped build my freezer stash!). It was so comfortable to use too. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Pino

customer_reviews.title: Super convenient, easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Super convenient, easy to assemble, comfortable and great flow. But the squeaking others have mentioned is a major issue for me personally, since I pump at night in a tiny apartment where the noise travels and could wake up baby AND hubby. It's so loud! Yes cleaning out the parts in the middle of pumping helps but I have to do it every few minutes which is unproductive!!! Disappointing since otherwise I love the pump. I prefer using medela for this reason (though it's also not perfect - leaks at the bottom of flange).
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat low suction
customer_reviews.text: We purchased to have a stock of milk when my wife returned to work. It is very compact and easily fits in her work bag allowing her to use it during breaks at work. It is also very easy to clean and sanitize all the inner parts. My wife ended up only using it for 2 weeks as the suction was so low that it was easier for her to manually squeeze her milk instead of using the pump. For reference, her cup size is A but we still expected much better results.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Very Effective (beware of squeaking!)
customer_reviews.text: I have two different electric pumps which are just fine, and two newborns that like to eat. But I swear nothing is as effective as this manual pump. It takes me a while to empty each side out, but I produce a lot when I use this pump. It's comfortable and easy to use and clean. One note is that the top portion may squeak while using it because of the silicone part rubbing the plastic part. The manufacturer addressed this in a forum and suggested dampening the silicone portion which works like a charm! I bet you could use cocoa butter or lanolin as well. All in all, even the squeaking couldn't bring down my rating for this pump!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha L.

customer_reviews.title: but my customers are super supportive. This pump gives me the frredom to ...
customer_reviews.text: I am a breast feeding mom and a bartender. It's hard to sneak away for a pumping break (usually work alone), but my customers are super supportive. This pump gives me the frredom to pump for 5-15 min as time allows. I usually do it in my car, but sometimes in the bathroom because we don't have an office. The hand pump helps since i don't have outlets available.
customer_reviews.author: Netty

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is the only pump I will use as a mother of 4 who works full time and always on the go. This lets me pump everywhere without needing a plug and helps me pump fast and efficiently. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Lupe Gonzales

customer_reviews.title: Simple and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Simple and easy to use. Can use on the go. Great suction. Definite improvement of design. Used previous Avent pump with both my boys with better success than an electric pump. This one same success! FYI if you do live above 3000 elevation the electric pumps don't work well, even hospital grade, which did not work as well as this manual pump. Huge difference with the manual being best, hands down!
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: I love this pump
customer_reviews.text: I love this pump! I exclusively pump and also have a double electric pump but I usually prefer this. I get more milk faster and it is much easier to use/clean and can take it anywhere! It is also very comfortable and does not hurt like my electric pump does.
customer_reviews.author: J S

customer_reviews.title: Not my favorite
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to have a manual back up in my car. I have a manual lansinoh at work already figured I would try a different brand so have something different. I couldn't get quite the suction I can with my lansinoh and I feel like the flange is not deep enough and the range of movement of the pump squeeze is less which makes for less pull. I prefer the other pump and have already put this one away in storage.
customer_reviews.author: ShelbyAM

customer_reviews.title: Great pump
customer_reviews.text: This is the most comfortable and convenient manual pump there is. The handle is smooth and the suction is great sp it doesnt make your hands as tired and crampy as other pumps do. I am very impressed and would recommend this pump to anyone
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase I could have made
customer_reviews.text: All it took was one unavoidable melt down in the car with my 2 month old to convince me to purchase this. Best purchase I could have made! Definitely make sure you take apart ALL of the pieces to wash before use again- black mold inside the silicone suction wasn't super appealing to me or my daughter. I extra love that I can pump directly into her bottles and not have to worry about too many dirty pieces while on the go.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: but the silicone insert in the flange feels very comfortable. I will have to update this in January/February ...
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had a chance to use this yet, but the silicone insert in the flange feels very comfortable. I will have to update this in January/February after I've given birth and have a chance to use it. I'm hoping this will work with the adapters I have for my milk bags. If not, I can always transfer or store in bottles. I have Tommee Tippee Pump and Go milk storage bags and Kindii Twist Milk storage bags that I plan on using with this.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy

customer_reviews.title: Older version worked better for me
customer_reviews.text: I recently broke my older Avent Manual pump. I dropped it and the it cracked. I was excited for this newer design with less parts and a more ergonomic bottle. While I love the bottles, this pump did not work as good for me as the older design. I can't get the same suction. I have a low production and perhaps another issue because I cannot get very much from an electric pump (1-2oz on one side and 2-3oz on the other side). With my older Avent manual pump I could definitely get more milk. The older version had better suction. Though both the old one and the new one are a tad on the noisy side.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer DiPietro

customer_reviews.title: Works as well as I hoped
customer_reviews.text: I’ve heard good things from Moms who have used this pump so I decided to give it a try. Now I prefer this manual pump over the electric one I own. I ebf and don’t pump much so it’s a lot more convenient for me to use a manual pump. I like how it’s more portable and doesn’t have as many parts to clean and sterilize. I usually pump about 4-5 oz at a time with an electric pump and I can get just as much out with this one but obviously takes a little longer.
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: I prefer it over the electrical pump and it works great for me
customer_reviews.text: I use this every day! I prefer it over the electrical pump and it works great for me. When my milk came in I had a very strong letdown and too much milk. My milk supply has calmed down a lot but I can still pump a 4+ oz bottle in about 15 minutes 6 months postpartum with this hand pump. The electrical is still convenient when I want to pump two bottles but with this hand pump I can move about the house and do small things. It's super comfy on the boob and fits well in the hand.Totally recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: Love the manual pump for on the go. It's so small, especially with 4oz bottle. It fits into a small purse so no need to drag around a big pump bag or diaper bag. The cover that goes on the breast is so soft and doesn't seem too cold when you put it on. The whole things comes apart so it's very easy to clean. Works pretty good. One downside is that as you pump, sometimes the plastic handle starts squeaking, I guess from plastic pieces rubbing against each other. It's not too loud but it has happened.
customer_reviews.author: VS

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me.
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't get any suction with this...not sure if it's the pump itself that is defective or if it just didn't work with my particular breast size? It squeeked loudly with each pump too. Thought this would be handy for on the go but I'd rather lug around my electric pump! Looked really nice and comfortable, I had high hopes for this. :-(
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Quick, effective and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pump to use when I didn't want to fool with my Hygeia double electric pump. It's great! The flanges with the massage cushions are comfortable and really help to stimulate letdown. I can pump both breasts just as quickly with this manual as I can with my double electric. The only drawback is that the mechanism can start to squeak after a few minutes of use due to condensation. Coating the pump membrane with lanolin keeps the squeaking at bay. With that fix, this is perfect for pumping at work because it's quiet, quick and much easier to haul around than a large electric pump.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Kirby

customer_reviews.title: Portable, efficient, and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I had been using electric dual pump first the medela symphony and now ameda purely yours and hands down this manual pump takes out more milk in 10mins than I have gotten with either electric pump. I enjoy how portable it is, I take the handle off and put it in a ziplock bag all the pieces and I'm all set to travel without the fear of engorgement.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: After maybe 10 uses it started sounding a little bit funny so I would still prefer an electric pump for ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pump to use during a work trip. Took it as carry on - to prevent drop in supply. It worked very well. After maybe 10 uses it started sounding a little bit funny so I would still prefer an electric pump for the major ise, and tgis one is great occasionally
customer_reviews.author: Michael S. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Love this pump!!!
customer_reviews.text: I never write reviews for products I purchase. But I love this pump so much I felt like I had to. I bought it to travel with so I wouldn't have to lug my Spectra pump with me through the airport. I have used this pump about 5 times so far and each time I get at least an ounce a minute! I brought it to work with me today and I got 4 ounces in about 4 minutes. Usually it takes me about 10 minutes to get that much with my electric pump. I highly recommend this pump to anyone. It is very simple to take apart and wash the parts also.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli Curtis

customer_reviews.title: More milk than electric
customer_reviews.text: I love this pump! I only get 1-3oz total from my highly praised electric pump but I get 5 oz every time with this. It does squeak sometimes but overall this thing rocks
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: WORKS GREAT FOR QUICK ON THE ROAD PUMPING
customer_reviews.text: WORKS GREAT FOR QUICK ON THE ROAD PUMPING. i USE THIS WHEN GOING OUT FOR A FEW HOURS AND I KNOW THAT I WONT BE HOME TO BE ABLE TO PUMP.
customer_reviews.author: amazonshopper#116118Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: It SQUEAKS
customer_reviews.text: I really dread using this avent pump. It makes such LOUD squeaky sound that it will be embarrassing to use outside. I bought this avent pump to replace my Ardo manual pump as it was making squeaky sound as well. But avent pump is worse. Just on the second day of using, it already squeaks and is loud. Apart from the noisy sound it makes, it does not stimulate milk production well. You have to press it hard against the breast to create the suction. It is so difficult to use as compare to my previous pumps. Is really a lousy pump.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Lim

customer_reviews.title: Manual pump >>> automatic pump
customer_reviews.text: My baby is 3 months old and I tried pumping with my very expensive automatic breast pump and I was unsuccessful at getting milk that way.. I thought that I just wasn't responding to pumping at all my friend told me to try a manual pump so now I have 28 oz saved in 2 weeks I'm so happy with this product it is perfect And seems like it would fit any sized nipple (saying this because my other pump has like 5 different sized cups you can choose from)
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Worth the $ to have a back up
customer_reviews.text: At first I wasn't sure how I would like this particularly based on the $30 but it was a great purchase. Easy to assemble and clean as well as use. This is great to have if I need a silent pump and also if something happens to my breast pump that I use (battery operated etc). The only thing I like better is having two at once though as when I start pumping on one breast the other starts to want to release milk too. Overall great product and purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend for quick no hassle pumping
customer_reviews.text: This worked better for me than an electric pump. It's designed very well. I am working just twice a week in schools so I needed somethIng I could use to pump quickly once in the afternoon. I can pump both breasts in about 10 mins and it gets me though the day until I can get home to my baby. The only drawback is it makes a loud squeak when you lever the pump- the convenience of it completely makes up for it though. I highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Charloktta

customer_reviews.title: Great Pump!
customer_reviews.text: I received this pump a few days after ordering and am very satisfied! I have used the Medella Harmony with my previous child and always had so much trouble with it working properly. I had 2 Harmony pumps and the same issues with both! This pump is comfortable and easy to use. Yes your hand and forearm may hurt after awhile, but that should be expected with a manual pump. It takes me less than 10 minutes to empty both sides. I love the fact that it comes with a cover so it can go in my purse. I would recommend this product to any mom's on the go!
customer_reviews.author: MommaLove

customer_reviews.title: Convenient but noisy.
customer_reviews.text: Great hand-held, portable, basic breast pump. My favorite thing about it is that it's compatible with all of the other Avent bottles and breastmilk storage containers, so you can pump, store, and feed using one container. My only issues are that, because it is manual, it can give you a hand cramp after a while. I wouldn't want to use it more than 2-3 times a day. And also, it squeaks! But only sometimes, which makes it hard to locate the cause. This would be awkward if you're using it somewhere other than your home or car...
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: Check cushion size!!!
customer_reviews.text: The pump is unusable for me because it came with a 19.5mmm cushion which is too small. Description makes it look like the larger 25 mmm cushion is standard. Cushion is sold separately but need to purchase at least two for $8 each. Useless. Also annoying is the standard newborn nipple, when I prefer the preemie one, also have to buy separately, in pack of two.
customer_reviews.author: Ace's Mom

customer_reviews.title: just okay
customer_reviews.text: I got this little pump hoping that it I would be able to use it occasionally to pump for my daughter. I'm a first time mom and am learning that it takes a long time to get enough milk to make a bottle with a manual pump. I think once I get better at it the manual could work in a pinch (or when I am away from home, it is very portable) but to pump in any practical way the electric pumps are the way to go. I think since my body isn't used to pumping I only get an ounce or two when I use this pump. And it makes my hand tired.
customer_reviews.author: Mosey Moe

customer_reviews.title: Love this pump
customer_reviews.text: Love this pump! I also purchased Avent's electric pump and I meant to use this for travel. The manual pump became my go-to as I found it to be much quieter and more effective, plus you're not tied to a wall with an outlet. Convenient, effective and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: MissB

customer_reviews.title: There may be no use in crying over spilled milk, but those tears come anyways.
customer_reviews.text: Stopped using after I learned my lesson. Used 5 times, 3 times lost a few ounces of milk. I don't know if mine was defective, but it worked twice with no problem and 3 times losing precious, precious liquid gold. Never again!
customer_reviews.author: Caco

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been looking for a pump that has a common sense design. The diaphragm has a sturdy pull tab so that when taking it apart to clean you don’t have to use a needle nose plier to get it off. The handle is easy to pump with, I have small hands. Best of all the cap that goes over the breast cup fits snugly enough to throw it in the diaper bag and not worry about it piping off. It does make a slight sound while pumping but it’s way quieter then any other I’ve tried.
customer_reviews.author: Mnell

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I received an electric pump through my insurance company. I liked it but I was tethered to an outlet, I was uncomfortable and hated all the parts. I was already using the Avent Natural bottles so pumping directly to the bottle was great. It was SO comfortable. I was able to pump a larger supply more quickly. It was also quiet enough to pump while holding a sleeping baby with no leakage.
customer_reviews.author: art123ist

customer_reviews.title: Better than electric pump.
customer_reviews.text: Better than electric pump. It is easy to use and it is extremely comfortable. Easy to pull apart and clean and put back together. Only reason I gave 4 starts is because I wish it held more than 4 oz. I usually produce more than that between both breasts and having to empty it out halfway through is annoying. Other than that it works very well and let down happens quickly.
customer_reviews.author: EB

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! Way better than my madela. I doubled my output and got 12oz per pump session. Only drawback is diaphragms are impossible to find...I got lucky someone was selling them on EBAY
customer_reviews.author: Hello

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice affordable hand pump. I rented a machine when I first started nursing to establish my milk supply. I bought this pump originally as a back up. After the first month, I went to just using this pump. I find it comfortable (much more than the machine we rented), easy to use, and effective. It is also very convenient. No electricity or batteries needed. The milk goes right into a bottle so you are not swapping out containers to feed the baby. Easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great for a manual pump
customer_reviews.text: Great for a manual pump. I love the bottles to be used with it. very comfortable to use, and easy to clean/maintain.
customer_reviews.author: Kaycee Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Good manual pump
customer_reviews.text: Works faster then my avent double electric breast pump and more efficient too. After using my electric I can still hand express about 2 1/2 oz out of both my breasts together. After using this I'm lucky if I can hand express even another 1/2oz. I don't even bother hand expressing after using this, but you do have to get some getting used to this. It wears your hand out very quickly
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlin Kitner

customer_reviews.title: Great pump. Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Great pump. Easy to use. Doesn’t tire out your hand. Warning! Flange is small so if you have larger nipples or breasts this may not work. I haven’t been able to find out if they make a size bigger in the flanges/cushions. This is the only reason I gave only 4/5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Deeder

customer_reviews.title: amazing pump!
customer_reviews.text: I'll preface this with I have never used a manual pump, just a medela single electric. I was weary of getting enough milk with this and also because I read this isn't good for large breasts- I'm not sure how large these other women are, but I am a D cup and I got 4 oz from one side with no struggles in less than 5 minutes. Sure its annoying pumping, but its a manual. Its not electric. Poor reviews solely based on the fact that it bothers your hand is silly since it never claimed to be automatic. This is plenty comfortable in my opinion and efficient. I would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Peaceful Pines

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I want to be able to go on dates with my husband and still make sure that my baby is getting her needed nutrients! It works well so far and I haven't had any pumping problems and my hand doesn't hurt afterwards. I think maybe the complaints from people who say that it squeaks or hurts their hand are pumping too fast. I can pump slowly with this and still get a steady stream of milk. However, I realize that everyone is different and milk output isn't the same for all. If you don't have a problem expressing milk on your own, I don't think you'll have a problem with this pump.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie C. Baker

customer_reviews.title: I can finally pump!
customer_reviews.text: Used an electric pump through 2 babies and never got more than a quarter of an ounce at a time. This pump is excellent, i can express an ounce in just a couple minutes on just one side! I like how much control I have over the speed and strength of suction. The handle is pretty ergonomic and so far hasn't hurt or fatigued my hands. I can't believe how long it took me to try a good manual pump! I've been ordering items from Amazon for years and this is my first review. I'm so pleased with this pump, I wanted other moms to know.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great manual pump
customer_reviews.text: I love using this manual pump. It seems effective and is very comfortable. It's slightly annoying that only Avent bottles will fit it, but since I transfer to freezer bags anyway, it's not a big deal. The pieces are easy to clean and I love that the pump comes with a cover.
customer_reviews.author: Surreptrixious

customer_reviews.title: Good pump, wish it came with an adapter
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use pump, with my only complaint being that you can't use any bottle but the avent brand. I bought this before knowing which bottle my daughter would accept (I was hoping for this line but she didn't like the nipples and it let's in a lot of air). Ultimately, my daughter preferred the mam bottles. So now I am stuck with this pump and have to transfer all milk to different bottles. Super annoying.
customer_reviews.author: belledonne33

customer_reviews.title: It might get a little tiresome if you were using it as your only form ...
customer_reviews.text: It might get a little tiresome if you were using it as your only form of pumping, but it's a great pump for emergency back-up or quick sessions to relieve some pressure between feedings. The cushioned shield is comfortable and creates a good seal, and it's been easy to clean up after pumping.
customer_reviews.author: Inara

customer_reviews.title: will not stay together, maybe mine is defective?
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this design suggests it should be wonderful, but the milk reservoir WILL NOT stay screwed into the rest of the assembly. It's so precarious, it seems like it will fall off at the slightest movement, which obviously doesn't work when you're hand pumping. Returning and researching another brand to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: I felt like it started losing suction after a bit and it just wasn’t creating a great seal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A milking monster
customer_reviews.text: My wife absolutely loves this little monster! As a man I can't really tell what's so great about it but my wife says this thing is a milking monster :) used to have a super loud electrical pump this pump does the wonder better and quieter. On the first 2-3 times my wife had problems with cleaning and assembly as this does disassemble to ~6 parts which could be a little annoying to disassemble and reassmeble and I suppose some parts will wear out in time and need replacing but now after more than a month she's so good at it I don't think she minds anymore!
customer_reviews.author: Ben Pere

customer_reviews.title: Painful
customer_reviews.text: Using this pump is an excruciating experience. It has a lot of suction and it didn't fit quite right. It is sized for an "average" user, so if you need a pump flange size that is just a little bit bigger than standard, using this pump will result in agony.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I am a mom that has a beautiful little girl that wants her food immediately
customer_reviews.text: I am a mom that has a beautiful little girl that wants her food immediately; therefore, we have issues with latching and/or staying latched. I so badly wanted to give her breast milk, but due to her not latching and not wanting to be put down it was difficult to even pump with those electric pumps. This handheld is PERFECT!! I can get multiple 10min sessions within a day, and it undoubtedly produces more milk than the electric ones I own. Love this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kelbel

customer_reviews.title: it does create a pretty good suction for a manual pump and was convenient ...
customer_reviews.text: I needed a pump for when I was on the go and this wasn't it. I have a medela pump in style and can get about 3-4 oz each time I pump, but with this I would get about 2 oz. it also squeaked a lot when I used it. it does create a pretty good suction for a manual pump and was convenient since these are the bottles we use but I was disappointed. it was also very comfortable and I wish my medela pump had that cushion!
customer_reviews.author: L. Ferri

customer_reviews.title: I don't know if I can write enough good things about this pump
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if I can write enough good things about this pump. I responded so well to this pump and gave up my electric after getting almost twice of what the electric was. The flange cover is really nice and everything comes apart easily making it a breeze to clean. My son also really liked the bottle nipple that comes with this.
customer_reviews.author: Ali B

customer_reviews.title: ... high hopes for this pump since I use and like the Avent feeding bottles that are compatible
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this pump since I use and like the Avent feeding bottles that are compatible. I bought it as a back up to put in the car for emergencies, but I am not able to get more than a few drops of milk using this pump. It would not even work in an emergency. I cannot recommend it and wish I had not purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina

customer_reviews.title: Amazing manual pump - a great addition to your pumping regimen!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase of this pump. It's an awesome addition to my Medela pump for those times when I'm traveling, or just need to pump a little bit quickly. It's remarkably comfortable and effective. I'm amazed that more electric pumps don't have a soft insert like this has - it makes the suction more comfortable and sort of realistic.
customer_reviews.author: District Jen

customer_reviews.title: Really great product!
customer_reviews.text: Really great product! I never succeeded to pump during my previous babies, this is my 3rd baby, i don't know why but milk supply is too much this time, i had several sleepless nights with heavy full breast and baby was too full to drink it all, today i tried my pump andit works great! No pain and milk comes just like natural feeding, in 3-4 mins i pumped 120ml milk which is a miracle! Thank you Avent!
customer_reviews.author: Nara Rosie

customer_reviews.title: Portable, easy, and quick
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a just in case to my main pump. So glad I did. I’ve used it so much. I have oversupply and fast letdown and this has been a very easy and quick option to pump off milk so our baby can eat in comfort. It’s easy to clean and use and I move found it to be comfortable. My only issue is that it can be somewhat squeaky while in use.
customer_reviews.author: Tarina Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have the older version of this pump and love it - it works better than the expensive electric Medela pump . I was very disappointed with this one, however. The mechanism seems to be very sensitive and has to be put a particular way to create suction. I constantly find myself readjusting the rubber parts to get the thing to suck, and when it does, the suction is not as strong. So I rarely use this pump because the older version is so much better, faster and easier.
customer_reviews.author: olga

customer_reviews.title: I love this hand pump
customer_reviews.text: I love this hand pump! I have a Spectra 2 electric pump at home and use this Avent hand pump at work. The silicone shield is very comfortable - even more comfortable than Spectra. The bottle is also interchangeable with the Spectra bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Kate W

customer_reviews.title: I’m keeping it around for emergency backup purposes but not a great option for me
customer_reviews.text: This is the only manual pump I’ve tried so maybe this is true of all manual pumps but I could only express about half the amount that I could get with my electric (spectra s2). I’m keeping it around for emergency backup purposes but not a great option for me.
customer_reviews.author: CL

customer_reviews.title: For the money not bad but I think the flange should be longer so ...
customer_reviews.text: For the money not bad but I think the flange should be longer so that milk doesn't just spray at the back of the flange. I don't have great supply. My milk doesn't flow like a stream so too much of the moisture doesn't end up in the bottle. The parts are easy to clean and reassemble. I will use for emergency or travel use.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy Sue

customer_reviews.title: Didn't help supply and was painful
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because I wanted to see if my supply would increase with a hand pump. It did not. In fact, the suction is so strong it bruised my nipples after only 5 minutes of use. I found the process to be much more lengthy and bothersome than using a double electric pump.
customer_reviews.author: Brocko

customer_reviews.title: 2) the bottle unscrews too easily and I've almost lost an entire bottle of milk ...
customer_reviews.text: It is an effective manual breast pump but I experienced a few issues. 1) the flange is too small for me and there is not way to get around that. 2) the bottle unscrews too easily and I've almost lost an entire bottle of milk because of it. It is more effective at getting out the milk than the electric pump I have. Cuts down on the time by about half.
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: This thing sucks! Literally!
customer_reviews.text: I love my advent manual pump. I honestly use it more than my double electric Medela pump. It seems to do a much better job of getting more milk out and it’s not painful at all! The silicone on the flange massages while you pump and I think that’s why I get so much more than when I use my electric pump. It does take some time but it’s worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Becca LaChapelle

customer_reviews.title: This is amazing! I like this way more than my Madela ...
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing! I like this way more than my Madela electric pump. Much easier to use and I get more milk in a faster amount of time. This is so convenient. I used it on a roadtrip during Hurricane Irma to pump in the car, and since we didn't have power. Saved me! I haven't used my electric pump since I got this!
customer_reviews.author: Catherine E.

customer_reviews.title: Product sucks
customer_reviews.text: I am an Avent customer for both my children and I bought this in hopes of not having to lug around my electric pump; however, this thing is terrible. It has absolutely no suction and when you so finally get some relief it takes at least thirty minutes to get it done. Do not waste your time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Vega

customer_reviews.title: As manual as it can get
customer_reviews.text: The product delivers what is promised by design. Willing to invest time in the labour of manual pumping? If yes, then this is a must buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Love it, but needs improvement.
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to try this pump since we love all of our other Avent products. So far it's great but I have two complaints. 1. The pump is EXTREMELY noisy. It squeaks so loud that my electric pump is actually quieter. 2. The bottle is constantly coming loose.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Squeaky & Painful
customer_reviews.text: It pumps well, but it’s way too small for my nipple and hurts really bad. It also squeaks really loud. I’ve only used it a couple of times because it’s so noisy & painful. I’m an exclusive pumper and I read really good reviews on this product so I’m disappointed it didn’t work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Tawntawn

customer_reviews.title: Lasts longer than Medela Harmony
customer_reviews.text: Squeaky like everyone else said, but I prefer this one to the Medela harmony. It's more comfortable to use, and seems much sturdier. I had to get replacement parts for the Harmony within a month of use 2-3 times a day, not realizing it was meant for "occasional time away from baby".
customer_reviews.author: bsschafe

customer_reviews.title: Too much of a good thing.
customer_reviews.text: This pump has great suction and is easy to assemble, but even when I ordered the larger cushion separately, it would pull part of my breast into the pump (more than the nipple), and leave a little red ring. I tried pulling the handle down less and it was still pretty uncomfortable. I am about a 38DDD-H.
customer_reviews.author: Leemo

customer_reviews.title: Squeeze & hold
customer_reviews.text: I love this breast pump. It did take me awhile to get the hang of it. This works well, but you have to squeeze and hold for a few seconds, then squeeze and hold again instead of constantly pumping with your hand. Once you figure it out, it works great!
customer_reviews.author: Leslie McFayden

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love hand pumps, mostly when my breastmilk starts flowing I can go as fast as the milk does! And it cuts my pumping time in half!!!
customer_reviews.author: Shelby

product_meta.title: Philips Avent Manual Comfort Breast Pump
product_meta.description:
Philips AVENT SCF330/20 Comfort Manual Breast Pump is uniquely designed for a more relaxing and comfortable expressing position to promote milk flow. Unlike breast pumps that only operate properly when you lean forward, the Philips AVENT Comfort Manual Breast Pump allows you to sit comfortably upright as you pump, while the pump's angled neck lets milk flow naturally from breast to bottle. When you are able to relax, you can produce more milk. This manual pump is great for moms who want to pump either at home or on the go. It features a soft massage cushion with 5 textured petals intended to help gently stimulate milk flow by mimicking your baby's natural suckling patterns. An ergonomic handle and lightweight, compact design makes it easy to operate with one hand. The collection container that connects to the pump also works as a bottle with the included natural, breast-shaped nipple. The nipple makes transitioning between breast and bottle easier for your baby by encouraging comfortable latch on. The breast pump also features an uncomplicated design with only a few parts that can all be washed in the dishwasher. It can also be sterilized using a Philips AVENT steam sterilizer or by boiling in water for 5 minutes.

BRAND STORY
By Avent

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


The Philips AVENT Comfort Manual Breast Pump has a unique design that enables a more relaxing and comfortable expressing position for easier milk flow. This BPA free manual pump is great for moms who want to pump either at home or on the go. It features a soft, textured massage cushion to help gently stimulate milk flow, an ergonomic handle you can operate with one hand, and a lightweight, compact design. 

MANUAL BREAST PUMP (SCF330/20)
AT A GLANCE:
 * Allows you to sit comfortably upright while you pump
 * Soft, textured massage cushion helps stimulate milk flow
 * Ergonomic handle for easy one-handed operation
 * Includes new Natural bottle with Natural nipple
 * Compatible with both Natural and Classic AVENT bottles

The breast pump has six pieces for easy assembly. View larger.

Textured massage cushion for comfort. 
View larger.

Express sitting upright. 
View larger.

Container converts for feeding. 
View larger.

The Philips AVENT Comfort Manual Breast Pump comes with a Natural bottle and Natural Nipple for easy feeding. 
View larger.

SIT COMFORTABLY UPRIGHT WHILE YOU PUMP
Unlike breast pumps that only operate properly when you lean forward, the Philips AVENT Comfort Manual Breast Pump allows you to sit comfortably upright as you pump. The breast pump's angled neck lets milk flow naturally from breast to bottle while you relax. And when you're able to relax it has a positive effect on your milk flow and quantity produced.

MASSAGE CUSHION STIMULATES MILK FLOW
The pump features a soft cushion with five textured petals intended to gently help stimulate milk flow. The cushion mimics your baby's natural suckling patterns to stimulate milk flow and make pumping more comfortable. 

This cushion fits a majority of moms, but a large cushion is sold separately.

INCLUDES NEW NATURAL BOTTLE AND NATURAL NIPPLE
To help prevent wasted milk, the collection container that connects to the pump also works as a bottle with the included natural, breast-shaped nipple. This nipple makes transitioning between breast and bottle easier for your baby by encouraging comfortable latch-on. 

ERGONOMIC HANDLE AND OTHER USER-FRIENDLY FEATURES
The breast pump has an uncomplicated design with only a few parts that are easily assembled and an ergonomic handle for comfortable positioning and operation with one hand. When it's time for cleanup, all parts can be washed in the dishwasher. 

The pump's compact size makes it ideal for storage and discreet use. It can be sanitized using a Philips AVENT steam sterilizer or by boiling in water for five minutes. 

CONTINUE BREASTFEEDING, EVEN ON THE GO
The Philips AVENT Comfort Manual Breast Pump is compatible with other Philips AVENT products, including Natural and Classic bottles and milk storage containers, which means you can pump whenever and wherever and save milk for later use. 

ABOUT PHILIPS AVENT
Since 1984, Philips AVENT has been designing and manufacturing products that are inspired by nature and developed through extensive research and clinical trials. Now, as part of the Philips Group, Philips AVENT produces innovative solutions that make feeding and caring for your baby easier. 

The Philips AVENT product range includes breastfeeding, bottle-feeding, toddler feeding, baby monitors, and newborn gifts. The products are designed to fit your busy life and make it easier for you to make the best choices for your baby. 

WHAT'S IN THE BOX
One Philips AVENT Comfort Manual Breast Pump, one standard-sized cushion, one 4-ounce Natural bottle, and one Natural newborn nipple. 

BPA FREE
BREAST PUMPS


Philips AVENT Comfort Double Electric Breast Pump SCF334/04
Philips AVENT Comfort Single Electric Breast Pump SCF332/01
Philips AVENT Comfort Manual Breast Pump SCF330/20Performance & FeaturesCompatible with Natural and Classic AVENT bottles•••Let-Down Massage Cushion•••Efficient & Quiet•••Express from Upright Position•••Pump Expression Settings••Automates Personal Rhythm••Hospital Grade Vacuum•Travel Bag•Clinically proven results comparable to a hospital grade pump•Type of UseWorking Full-time•••Working Part-time•••Occasional Missed Feedings••Traveling•••Double Pumping•Multiple Births•Medical ConsiderationsPremature/Hospitalized Baby•Low Milk Supply•Sore Nipples or Engorgement•••Flat or Inverted Nipples•••

See more
feature_bullets: More comfortable pumping position due to unique design
Soft, textured massage cushion helps stimulate milk flow
Compact, lightweight design of the pump body makes it easy to hold and position on your breast
Compatible with other Philips Avent feeding products, such as Natural and Classic bottles and breast milk storage containers
